description: The former prime minister is serving a year at an Alzheimer's hospice near Milan as punishment for tax fraud.
title: Italy's Silvio Berlusconi Starts Working at Alzheimer's Hospice
title_page: Italy's Silvio Berlusconi Starts Working at Alzheimer's Hospice
text:

Italy's scandal-hit former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi began a year of community service at a hospice for Alzheimer's patients Friday as punishment for his conviction for tax fraud.
The 77-year-old is one of the country's richest men with an estimated fortune of â‚¬6.5 billion (nearly $9 billion). He has been hit with a string of court cases in the past decade, including a conviction of paying for sex with an underage nightclub dancer.
Berlusconi arrived at the Sacra Famiglia Catholic hospice in Cesano Boscone, near Milan, on Friday morning in a black limousine, the U.K.'s Guardian newspaper reported.
He was heckled by an protester wearing a clown's hat who shouted: "To prison!" before he was led away, according to the BBC's correspondent in Italy.
